entry.title: PMDG Releases Boeing 777F for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. PMDG recently released their long-awaited Boeing 777F for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. This is one of the worldâs most popular cargo haulers still in production, famous for its fuel efficiency and range. Developed by Boeing to meet the ever-growing demand for highly efficient air cargo transport, it has been hugely successful since its introduction in 2009. Ever since, it has been carrying massive payloads across the globe for many different operators.Â Powered by two GE90-110B1 engines, which generate enough thrust to lift over 100,000 kilograms of cargo within 550 cubic meters, easily carrying oversized â and heavy â cargo to virtually any destination with a long enough runway. The add-on features an advanced simulation of all avionics and system management operations of the 777 flight deck, an accurately simulated display drawing process, a full electronic checklist, the PMDG Universal Flight Tablet, a full simulation of the 777âs autoflight director and autopilot systems, and more. The complete feature list follows below: â PMDG 777F features Avionics & Flight Deck: Air Conditioning System: Auto-flight System: Brakes and Tires: Cargo Main Deck: Datalink (Currently limited to Hopie Network for ATC services, but more coming!): Doors: Electrical System: Engines: Failures: Flight Controls and Flight Surfaces: Fly By Wire System: Fuel System: Ground Service Vehicles: Hydraulic System: Landing Gear: Lighting Systems: Navigation Data: Physics-based Flexing: Pneumatic System: Simulator Features: As mentioned in their last development update, the 777F is not yet compatible with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 due to issues with the new SDK. The airplane is available at PMDG.com for $54.99. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: FSA Announces FSExpo 2025 Registration Opening December 14
entry.summary: Sim: OTHER. The Flight Simulation Association (FSA) announced in a recent press release that registration for FlightSimExpo 2025 will open on December 14th. Starting next Saturday at 12 PM Eastern Time, you can sign up for the upcoming FlightSimExpo, which will be held in Providence, Rhode Island. For non-members, access from Friday to Sunday is priced at $80. For FSA First Officers, the cost is $72. If you are an FSA Captain, you will pay $64. However, if you are among the first 250 FSA Captains to register, your price will be just $50.Â â All pricing options include access to seminars and exhibit halls from Friday to Sunday. Participants will also receive access to post-event seminar recordings, a welcome drink during Fridayâs reception, and coffee and tea provided on Saturday and Sunday mornings.Â â If you are unable to attend FlightSimExpo in person, you can register for live and recorded seminar access for $15. FSA Captains can access this content for free. If you or your team would like to sponsor, exhibit, or speak at the Expo, FlightSimExpo invites developers to register using the following link. Regarding travel and accommodation, discounted rates are currently available. According to co-founder Evan Reiter, one-third of the available rooms have already been booked. The discounted hotel rates represent some of the lowest group rates for a 4-star hotel in downtown Providence during a summer event. You can find more details about accommodation and travel at the following link. FlightSimExpo 2025 will be held in Providence from June 27 to June 29. Registration will open next week on December 14, so set your alarms if you plan to attend next year's FlightSimExpo. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: FlightSimLabs Releases Airbus A321ceo for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FlightSimLabs has just launched its highly anticipated version of the Airbus A321ceo for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. This rendition of the longest variant in the Airbus A320ceo family is now available to take to the virtual skies. The Airbus A321ceo is a twin-engine, single-aisle commercial aircraft that had its first flight in 1993. Since then, a total of 1,784 A321ceos have been built and delivered. This model can be equipped with either CFM or IAE engines and can feature sharklets or wingtip fences. The A321ceo is the predecessor to the newer A321neo, with the primary difference being the new engine option in the neo version. The A321ceo is operated by airlines around the world, including American Airlines, Turkish Airlines, and Lufthansa. FlightSimLabâs rendition of the Airbus A321ceo includes a wide range of features. It offers options for both CFM and IAE engines, as well as variants with wingtip fences and sharklets. The aircraft model is highly detailed, showcasing realistic weather and environmental effects. Additional features include dynamic failures, aircraft aging, an electronic flight bag (EFB), GSX integration, and much more, all contributing to a highly realistic simulation of the aircraft and its systems. The newly released Airbus A321ceo is now available for purchase directly from FlightSimLabs for $69.95. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: MK Studios Release Zurich for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. MK Studios has released its latest scenery for MSFS20 and 24. The team has headed to Zurich, Switzerland's largest city, offering many custom features and high-quality models. Zurich acts as the main gateway into Switzerland having served 28.9 million passengers in 2023. It is also the main base for the flag carrier airline: Swiss. Allowing for routes across Europe and further. The team have made sure to allow for compatibility with both sims allowing users from FS20 & 24 to utilise it. entry.title: Headwind Simulations Updates Airbus A339X and SU95X for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Headwind Simulations has recently released updates for its A339X and SU95X projects for MSFS. The new update integrates SayIntentions.AI ACARS and CPDLC into both aircraft. SayIntentions.AI is an AI ATC (Air Traffic Control) plugin designed for various flight simulators. It provides features such as ATC, copilots, cabin crew, and more, all powered by artificial intelligence. A key component of the ATC functionality in SayIntentions.AI includes ACARS (Aircraft Communications Addressing and Reporting System) and CPDLC (Controller-Pilot Data Link Communications). These systems facilitate communication between the ground and the aircraft, allowing for interactions between air traffic controllers and pilots. â With the recent integration of ACARS and CPDLC from SayIntentions.AI into Headwind Simulationâs aircraft, users can now access these features. Please note that a Premium Membership is required to utilise this feature. The latest updates for the A339X and the SU95X are now accessible via the Headwind Simulations installer. Since the update is part of the pre-release channels, be sure to select this option for the most recent update. For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: ToLiss Updates A319 to v1.10
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. ToLiss has released an update for the A319, after nearly a year since the last one. The v1.10 update brings improvements to aircraft systems and failures, as well as various bug fixes. The update has improved the hydraulic systems, MCDU, ECAM, and FMGS, added new failures, such as slow and rapid decompression, cargo smoke, wind shears and high lift failures (e. g. Elevator faults), brought visual improvements, and added new circuit breakers (bringing the total number of interactive C/B to 242!), as well as adding the ISCS (Interactive Simulation Control System) to the EFB. The full changelog is as follows: - ISCS in EFB - Hydraulic improvement package: . Added simulation of trapped hydraulic fluid in asymmetric actuators such as landing gear or spoiler actuators. . Fixed the PTU overheat when ENG1 is failed. - MCDU improvement package: . CLR command is now indented in scratchpad as in real life . DIR TO page prefills the RADIAL IN on the DIR TO page as required . FPLN Page Destination EFOB turns amber, if below minimum required. - ECAM improvement package: . Overspeed warning now triggers based on actual flap/slat position and not lever position (PFD barber pole is still lever position driven as in real life.) . Removed duplication of system titles if the same system shows multiple subsequent rows of ECAM messages. . Weight display logic for SD: Prior to engine start, the dashes are now cyan. Weights now only show after engine start, like in real life. . Status page improvement: Approach procedures for hydraulic faults . Rework of the ECAM messages for electrical bus failures to represent a newer FWC standard - FMGS improvement package: . Added possibility to use Airport ICAO codes as waypoints . Bug fixes for the path computation leading to an overall much stabler path computation in complex procedures. . Empty flight plan shows as PPOS / Discon rather than just "End of flpn" and can be built up from there. . VIA selection is now automatic, if there is exactly one VIA that matches the selected FINAL and STAR. . Constraints of first waypoint in STAR are not dropped anymore. - Added cross track error display on ground prior to departure - New failure modes: . Slow and rapid decompression . THS jam. . Cargo smoke, including latched closure of the isolation valves . Added high lift failures, including loss of SFCC channels and slats/flaps lock . Windshears with correct REAC W/S detection and indication. - Visual improvement package: . Added AoA Vanes to fuselage model . Fixed the tiller textures . Animated the flap lever guard . Correct the eye reference ball colors and location . Fixed text overlaps on the overhead panel - Added new Circuit breakers (for high lift, air conditioning packs, ...) bringing the total to 242 - Added pitch influence to the RADALT value, so that the RADALT decreases when you pitch up (like IRL) - Added limitation with filtering to the maximum number of waypoints shown on ND when WPT overlay selected. - Quick starts for engine and APU are now available on the Joystick/Actions tab. - Mapped flight number to x-plane dataref "sim/cockpit2/radios/actuators/flight_id" for third party plugin interfacing. - Improved Master Warning flashing frequency. - Terrain on ND drawing around the airport is now inhibited for areas of same elevation as the airport. - If you select a livery with 2 OWE pairs, the maximum number of passengers will increase to 160. - Added selected heading value on ND, if in ARC mode the heading bug is not visible. â Bug fixes: - Fixed issue with the interaction between the CLR button and the status page - Fixed issue with status page overflow. - The emergency generator now consumes hydraulic fluid. - The magnetic variation model now updates for the current year. - Fixed FMA alignment of armed modes and issue with empty boxes - Extended the permissible value range for FCU speed window to 399kts and Mach 0.99 like in real life - Extended the permissible value range for FCU altitude window to 49000ft like in real life - ISI startup correction: QNH is also visible during ISI startup; moved QNH to right location. - Removed CHG CODE field for other phases than PREFLIGHT or DONE. - Improved string termination on MCDU string datarefs. - Fixed an issue with SID route in alternate plan on first alternate plan programming. - Fixed an issue with waypoints preceded by a discon where the outgoing leg is of the CI/CD/CR/CA or VI/VR/VD type. - Fixed FMA indication for managed descent on profile with significantly too slow speed. - Fixed behaviour of the FCU HDG managed dot when a managed mode (NAV, LOC, APPR) is armed. - Fixed shape of the ADF2 needle on the ND. - Removed GS indication on ND, when the associated ADIRU is OFF or invalid. - Made the deceleration when descending through the SPD LIM altitude smoother. - Fixed issue with the beta target leading to excessive rudder deflection and spoiler extension on the wrong side. - Corrected the color of the RAM Air Inlet indication when open in flight. - Disabled autobrake if 2 or more SECs are lost. - Fixed a bug that could cause sending many requests to the Hoppie network in a short period of time. - Miscellaneous other bug fixes Due to the migration of the updater repository, ToLiss recommends to perform a clean reinstall and download the aircraft from the store.Â â The ToLiss A319 for X-Plane 11 and 12 is available for purchase on the X-Plane.org store, Aerosoft store and Simmarket for approximately $89.99. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news and reviews! â

entry.title: Fenix Simulations Updates A320 Family for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fenix Simulations has issued a micro-update to their A320 Family (A319/A320/A321) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, bringing more fixes to their 2024 port on systems, art, and tweaks to the EFB (both platforms). Update 2.3.0.553 is the fourth product line update since it was made compatible with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024. It further enhances compatibility and improves overall stability by mitigating an issue where the aircraft would restart upon switching camera views or changing settings. A potential crash when handling inputs was also found and addressed. On the art side of things, they have fixed the registration and SELCAL not appearing at all, although they still appear black for the time being, and rain now travels in the correct direction. Their EFB has also undergone tweaking to fix potential errors when retrieving METARs with invalid data and to remove a slight pixel gap at the bottom of the app bar. The product line is available on their website for roughly $114 at the time of writing. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

The aircraft has been in development for over five years and is slated for release on December 12th at 17:00Z TorqueSim has stated that the aircraft will be âstudy levelâ, and says it will include a fully custom Honeywell avionics suite designed to closely replicate the functionality of the real-world aircraft, including immersive sounds, as well as a highly detailed cabin. The CitationJet family includes the original C525, along with the C525A, B, and C variants, each of them having their own submodels. entry.title: TorqueSim Releases TakeCommand! CitationJet 525 for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. TorqueSim has released their long-awaited CItationJet 525 for X-Plane 12. After more than six years of development, one of the most popular business jets is finally here! Produced to replace the ageing Citation I and IIs, the Cessna CitationJet 525 had its first flight in April 1991 and has since been developed into Model 525A, 525B, and 525C. Over 2000 CitationJets have been produced, making them the most produced business jets. Capable of cruising up to altitudes of 41,000ft and equipped with two Williams R-R FJ44-1A turbofan engines, this T-tail jet can fly at Mach 0.65 for around 1560 nautical miles ( ~2880km). The TorqueSimâs rendition of CitationJet 525 features an authentic flight model with custom airfoils, custom soundpack, high-resolution textures, custom-developed electrical, hydraulic, fuel, and pneumatic systems, custom Honeywell avionics. It also supports RealityXP GNS/GTN, as well as the upcoming TDS Sim GTNXi. The TakeCommand! CitationJet 525 is available for purchase at the X-Aviation store for $84.95.Â It is compatible with X-Plane 12 only and can be used on MacOS 12+ (at least Monterey), Windows 10+, and Linux (support is provided only for Ubuntu 24.02 LTS). The recommended specifications for it are CPU with 4+ Cores (3 GHz+), 16+ GB RAM, and NVIDIA or AMD GPU with 4+ GB VRAM. â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news and reviews! â
